data.text:
I met Arthur C. Clarke when I visited the Island in the 1980’s. He lived in an uptown area of Colombo. I went to the gate to see if I could talk to him. A reporter in another country wanted to know if he would give her time for a story. I remember he said, “if she can ask me a question that has never been asked of me to answer, then I will give her an hour.” She had a 2 hour interview. As for me the servant came to the gate to ask me what I wanted. So I told him. I cannot remember if he went away to ask Mr Clarke permission but I remember been ascoted into his residence. The outside boundary walls were as high as the house. He shook my hand. He took me up to the first floor and as I waked up the stairs above the middle landing on the wall was a picture of the planet Earth taken from space. The first floor was a large open plan area with computers in a row up against the far wall. He asked me where I was from and I told him. He went up to one of the computers and dialed the TV channel for the country and the test pattern came up. The dial was a rotary gadget on the table to find the channel. On his roof was a large satellite dish, and I mean a large one. When the test pattern came up he said, “looks like nothing is happening”.
